intro: Lepidiberis, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small yellow flowers that are arranged in a cluster, often surrounded by bracts that resemble leaves. Lepidiberis typically grows in grassy areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
